result.execSummary:
The defendant Solomon R Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 12/31/16.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, thereapy and taking any prescribed medications.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

No alcohol or controlled substances.
No possession nor use of any BB guns or any other item designed to use projectile items.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Solomon R Graves in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Solomon R Graves in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for ZERO days.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12-31-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12-31-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No possession nor use of any BB Guns or any other item designed to use projectile items
-Trama treatment if available
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
May 11, 2015 @ 8:30A in BR 17, SB Rm 313 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Solomon R Graves not in court, in custody.  Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced. Defense counsel waives defendants appearance.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 5-11-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Solomon R Graves in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Solomon R Graves in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Solomon R Graves in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Solomon R Graves in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
